FLOOD WARNING 
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE NORTH PLATTE NE 
1040 AM CDT FRI JUN 6 2014

...THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE IN NORTH PLATTE HAS ISSUED A FLOOD 
WARNING FOR THE FOLLOWING RIVERS IN NEBRASKA...

SOUTH PLATTE RIVER NEAR ROSCOE AFFECTING DEUEL AND KEITH COUNTIES.
  
.SNOWMELT RUNOFF FROM THE HEADWATERS OF THE SOUTH PLATTE
RIVER...ALONG WITH RECENT AND FORECAST RAINFALL WILL CAUSE THE RIVER
TO CONTINUE RISING OVER THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS. NEAR ROSCOE...THE
SOUTH PLATTE RIVER IS EXPECTED TO RISE ABOVE FLOOD STAGE
SUNDAY...THEN CREST BETWEEN 9.0 AND 9.5 FEET ON MONDAY
AFTERNOON...WHICH IS MINOR FLOODING. THE RIVER IS FORECAST TO STAY
ABOVE FLOOD STAGE INTO NEXT WEEK.

PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...

SAFETY MESSAGE...DO NOT DRIVE YOUR VEHICLE INTO AREAS WHERE WATER 
COVERS THE ROADWAY. THE WATER DEPTH MAY BE TOO GREAT TO ALLOW YOUR 
CAR TO CROSS SAFELY AND THE ROAD BENEATH MAY NOT BE INTACT. VEHICLES 
CAUGHT IN RISING WATERS SHOULD BE ABANDONED QUICKLY.
